results.title: [KenRa Films Present: the Kenneth Rankine Home Movie Collection: Reel 12]
results.brief_description:
Kenneth Carruthers Rankine (1890 - 1968) was a keen amateur cinematographer and filmmaker. This collection of his home movies has been donated to ACMI by Kenneth’s granddaughter. The collection represents a wonderful slice of life in Australia; with contents including scenes of everyday life, major family occasions, holidays around Victoria and views of Melbourne.

This film shows the family at a number of motor sports events held 1957 - 1959 at Templestowe, Albert Park and Phillip Island.

Selected highlights list:

00:00:10:00 to 00:02:30:00 shows the ‘25th Templestowe Hill Climb’ held Sunday, September 1st, 1957 (as we see from a program for the event that is being held in front of the camera.) The Templestowe Hill Climb was an annual car racing event held by the Victorian Sporting Car Club Ltd. on a 969 metre course constructed by the Club in 1951. The footage shows ordinary street cars participating as well as racing cars. There are close-ups of cars and their drivers and ‘action’ footage of cars driving the course.

00:02:31:00 we see program for the ‘33rd Templestowe Hill Climb’, Sunday, 22nd March 1959, tucked under the windscreen-wiper of a car. This is followed by footage of the 1959 event, which includes shots of the family and close-ups of the children.

00:05:30:00 racing car driver Stirling Moss signing autographs for the crowd that surrounds him.

00:09:06:00 - 00:09:18:00 we see close-up footage of the family having a picnic Albert Park Lake (Melbourne).

00:09:19:00 we see a program for the ‘Second Day: 24th March 1957, Victorian Trophy Race, Organised by the Light Car Club of Australia’ being held in front of the camera. The Light Car Club of Australia held motor races at Albert Park in between 1953 and 1958.

00:10:11:00 we see a poster for ‘The Argus International Motor Races Australian Grand Prix organised by the Light Car Club of Australia’, followed by footage of what appears to be the same event.

00:12:12:00 there is a brief shot of Albert Park Lake with Government House visible in the background.

00:12:16:00 a close-up of the family children transitions to a shot of the young son in a very similar pose at a slightly older age.

00:13:27:00 a programme issued by the Phillip Island Auto Racing Club is held in front of the camera, displaying the title ‘P.I.A.R.C. October Meeting Sunday, 27th October, 1957’. We then see the family picnicking at the event, and other spectators and parked cars, with Westernport Bay in the background. The reel ends with footage of the Phillip Island coast and racetrack.

results.title: [KenRa Films Present: the Kenneth Rankine Home Movie Collection: Reel 21]
results.brief_description:
Kenneth Carruthers Rankine (1890 - 1968) was a keen amateur cinematographer and filmmaker. This collection of his home movies has been donated to ACMI by Kenneth’s granddaughter. The collection represents a wonderful slice of life in Australia; with contents including scenes of everyday life, major family occasions, holidays around Victoria and views of Melbourne.

This film captures the Rankine/Woottons holidaying at Gosford, NSW coast.

Selected highlights list:

(No title)
00:00:00:00 to 00:00:05:00 up to this point, footage of a train travelling over a causeway from the mainland which can be identified as the Gosford area on the NSW coast.

00:00:06:00 - 00:00:18:00 panoramic footage being filmed from a vantage point above and where we see the Wootton family relaxed and on holidays as illustrated by their innovative footwear for the time: rubber thongs which were first produced in Australia by Dunlop in 1959.

00:00:19:00 to 00:00:44:00 footage of the bays and the town (presumably Gosford).

00:00:45:00 a prolonged shot of the three Wootton children looking more grown up and confident in front of the camera.

00:01:02:00 the family gather around what is likely to be a metal map on a pedestal for tourists.

00:01:45:00 footage is taken from a higher vantage point again at and includes a shot of fellow tourists at 00:01:52:00.

00:01:55:00 ‘Ploddy the Dinosaur’ (erected 1963) at the Australian Reptile Museum and Sanctuary at Gosford where we see snakes, lizards and other species in enclosures.

00:02:42:00 the family feeding tame kangaroos and cockatoos.
.

results.title: Return of the Sacred Kingfisher Festival 2000
results.brief_description: Each November since the Sacred Kingfisher was seen again in the Merri Creek environment, a festival has been held at CERES Community Environment Park to celebrate the return of this native bird to the area as part of its seasonal migration. The festival, with the participation of local schools and communities, also celebrates the cleanup and revegetation of the Merri Creek environs, and the work of CERES in the Melbourne suburb of Brunswick East.
results.description: Each November since the Sacred Kingfisher was seen again in the Merri Creek environment, a festival has been held at CERES Community Environment Park to celebrate the return of this native bird to the area as part of its seasonal migration. The festival, with the participation of local schools and communities, also celebrates the cleanup and revegetation of the Merri Creek environs, and the work of CERES in the Melbourne suburb of Brunswick East.

The festival, with the participation of local schools and communities, also celebrates the cleanup and revegetation of the Merri Creek environs, and the work of CERES in the Melbourne suburb of Brunswick East.

results.title: Remembering the past and looking forward to the future
results.creator_credit: Cuong Manh Pham, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: A story of escape by boat from Vietnam to a Malaysian refugee camp, and then to Australia in 1986 where Cuong Manh Pham eventually made a new life, reuniting with his family in 1990.

results.title: A Journey to a new land
results.creator_credit: Tuan Anh Tran, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Leaving family and escaping from Vietnam in 1978 and eventually arriving in Australia by boat as a refugee, it would be six years before Tuan Anh Tran could finally be reunited with his family.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tuan Anh Tran, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: China tour
results.creator_credit: ACMI, ACMI Digital Storytelling and Si Tuan Lieng
results.brief_description: Si Tuan Lieng and his wife are retirees and have recently made an overseas trip to China. In this story he talks about his life and family, their integration into Australian society since they left Vietnam over 26 years ago and highlights of their holiday in China.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI, ACMI Digital Storytelling and Si Tuan Lieng

results.title: Little journey
results.creator_credit: Keith Nguyen, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Keith remembers little of his early years - separated from his parents and living with his grandparents. His father had been sent to a Re-education Camp and his mother had moved away. On his father’s release from the Camp the family was reunited and several years later they escaped from the hardships of Vietnam to seek a better life in Australia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Keith Nguyen, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: About my dad
results.creator_credit: Huong Duy Pham, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Like his father, Huong Duy Pham was also a soldier in the South Vietnam Army. But his family connections were to prove too dangerous and Huong eventually escaped by boat and made his way to Australia where he is now living with his wife and three sons. He dedicates this story to his father.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Huong Duy Pham, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Like his father, Huong Duy Pham was also a soldier in the South Vietnam Army. But his family connections were to prove too dangerous and Huong eventually escaped by boat and made his way to Australia where he is now living with his wife and three sons. results.title: I left my country
results.creator_credit: Joseph Xuan-Minh Le, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In 1982 Joseph fled from Vietnam and its Communist regime finally arriving in Australia in 1983 as a refugee. He tells of his journey, of leaving family behind, his resettlement in Australia and how seven years later he was finally able to bring his family to Australia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joseph Xuan-Minh Le, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: In 1982 Joseph fled from Vietnam and its Communist regime finally arriving in Australia in 1983 as a refugee. He tells of his journey, of leaving family behind, his resettlement in Australia and how seven years later he was finally able to bring his family to Australia.
